study.Name: Study
study.Description: A dimly lit study lined with aged bookshelves and a large, claw-footed desk. Dust lingers in the air and a single green-shaded lamp flickers softly. A faint draft suggests a hidden passage might lie nearby.

hall.Name: Hall
hall.Description: A long entrance hall with polished marble floors, twin staircases sweeping upward, and antique portraits staring down from every wall. You feel as if the house itself is watching.

States.post-bomb: All of the furniture is destroyed and bits of wood and shards of glass litter the floor.

lounge.Name: Lounge
lounge.Description: A richly decorated sitting room with velvet curtains, high-backed chairs, and the lingering scent of cigar smoke. The room feels like it was made for secrets and whispers.

dining-room.Name: Dining Room
dining-room.Description: A long mahogany table stretches beneath a flickering chandelier. The silverware is still set, as if dinner had been interrupted — or never started at all.

kitchen.Name: Kitchen
kitchen.Description: Pots dangle from wrought-iron racks above stone counters. The smell of old spices and something more metallic lingers in the air. Knives rest suspiciously out of place.

ballroom.Name: Ballroom
ballroom.Description: An echoing chamber with a polished parquet floor and towering windows. Chandeliers overhead sway slightly, though there is no wind. Footsteps seem to follow your own.

conservatory.Name: Conservatory
conservatory.Description: Tall glass walls rise into a domed ceiling, letting moonlight bathe rows of exotic plants. Leaves rustle even when you’re still, and the air is thick with humidity.

billiard-room.Name: Billiard Room
billiard-room.Description: Faded green felt lines the billiard table at the center. Chalk dust covers the cues and a forgotten drink rests on a side table, still half full. Someone left in a hurry.

library.Name: Library
library.Description: Towering shelves filled with mismatched volumes stretch into shadow. A ladder leans nearby and a leather armchair sits by the fireplace. One book lies open on the floor.

candlestick.Name: Candlestick
candlestick.Description: A heavy brass candlestick, ornately sculpted and cold to the touch. Traces of soot and wax cling to its rim, but it feels more like a weapon than a decoration.

dagger.Name: Dagger
dagger.Description: A slim-bladed dagger with a jeweled hilt and a wicked edge. Though designed for elegance, its stained blade tells of more sinister use.

lead-pipe.Name: Lead Pipe
lead-pipe.Description: A bent section of lead piping, heavy and marred with rust. It's oddly out of place in such a refined mansion.

revolver.Name: Revolver
revolver.Description: A six-shot revolver, gleaming darkly. The chamber spins smoothly, but one bullet seems freshly fired.

rope.Name: Rope
rope.Description: A coarse, looped rope — expertly tied. It carries the scent of the outdoors, yet the fibers are frayed from recent tension.

wrench.Name: Wrench
wrench.Description: A large steel wrench coated in oil and grime. Its blunt weight gives it a deadly heft in untrained hands.

flashlight.Name: Black and Decker Flashlight
flashlight.Description: Powerful and reliable, this flashlight cuts through the darkness with a beam that feels almost alive. The batteries are fresh, and it hums softly when switched on.

States.default: The flashlight is off, waiting to be used.
States.on: The flashlight is on, illuminating the room with a steady beam.
States.off: The flashlight is off, leaving you in darkness.

cabinet.Name: Old Oak Cabinet
cabinet.Description: An antique oak cabinet with intricate scrollwork and a brass locking latch. It creaks ominously when disturbed.

States.locked: The cabinet is locked tightly, its ornate keyhole glinting with age.
States.unlocked: The cabinet stands unlocked, its contents waiting to be revealed.
States.open: The cabinet door hangs open, shadows curling around its empty interior.

scarlet.Name: Miss Scarlet
scarlet.Description: Miss Scarlet exudes charm and mystery. Draped in crimson silk, she glides through rooms like a whisper of perfume and suspicion. Her smile rarely reaches her eyes.

mustard.Name: Colonel Mustard
mustard.Description: Colonel Mustard stands tall and broad-shouldered, his military uniform still crisp despite his retirement. He speaks in clipped commands and never turns his back to a door.

white.Name: Mrs. White
white.Description: Mrs. White, the long-time housekeeper, moves with quiet efficiency. Her hands are always gloved, and her expression betrays years of buried secrets.

green.Name: Mr. Green
green.Description: Mr. Green fidgets nervously, adjusting his tie far too often. He speaks in practiced pleasantries, but his darting eyes suggest he's hiding more than gossip.

peacock.Name: Mrs. Peacock
peacock.Description: Mrs. Peacock is regal and razor-tongued, adorned in sapphire feathers and too much jewelry. She always knows who last entered the room — and why they shouldn't have.

plum.Name: Professor Plum
plum.Description: Professor Plum adjusts his glasses often and mutters to himself about motive and means. His intellect is vast, but his memory conveniently selective.
